intro: Microcos subepetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microcos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture.
